title.narrative: 2.3. Water, Sanitation, and Hygiene (WASH) ENABLING ENVIRONMENT

description.narrative: WASH sector institutional capacity and systems are strengthened for scaled-up equitable and sustainable access to basic improved WASH services, which contributes to Cross-Sectoral Monitoring, Data And Situation Analyses, Environmental Sustainability, Sanitation, Water, Water (Covid). UNICEF aims to achieve this through Advocacy And Public Engagement, Developing And Leveraging Resources And Partnerships, Evaluations, Research And Data, Systems Strengthening And Institution Building, United Nations Working Together. This contributes to the following Country Programme result: By 2021, more children and their families are living in an open defecation free environment, using improved drinking water sources and adopting improved hygiene practices

condition.narrative: Should contribute directly to results for children as outlined in the UNDAF, national results and/or UNICEF Strategic Plan and within the scope defined in the CPD, CPAP, OMP or other agreed upon programme documents

title.narrative: WASH sector institutional capacity and systems are strengthened for scaled-up equitable and sustainable access to basic improved WASH services

description.narrative: The Government of Sudan is better equipped to prioritize, implement and address emerging issues in the WASH sector, drawing upon new evidence and UNICEF's technical support for strategies and plans and improved capacity for monitoring and reporting through the developed Sudan WASH SDG6 plan, states ODF road maps and web-based WASH IMS. WASH issues for the humanitarian sector were also better coordinated and addressed through UNICEF's co-leadership of the WASH sector. | Status:On-track | As-of Date:31/12/2019
